intro: Cyrtomium balansae f. edentatum, commonly known as the toothless holly fern, is a rare fern species characterized by its distinctive fronds. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. The plant features lanceolate, serrate leaves with a unique absence of teeth along the margins, giving it its common name. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species for botanical gardens and specialized collections.
